rowspan="2" | The Mummy || $43,369,635 || The Mummy sets the record for a non-holiday May opening.|| https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W19/?ref_=bo_wey_table_41 |- | 20 || || $24,856,320 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W20/?ref_=bo_wey_table_40 |- | 21 || || rowspan="3" | Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace || $64,820,970 || Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menaces $28.5 million opening day gross broke The Lost World: Jurassic Parks record ($26.1 million) for the highest single-day tally of all-time and Independence Days record ($17.4 million) for the highest-grossing Wednesday of all-time. It also broke Indiana Jones and the Temple of Dooms record ($33.9 million) for the highest weekend debut for a prequel, Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (Special Edition)s record ($35.9 million) for the highest weekend debut for a PG-rated film, and Independence Days record ($50.2 million) for the largest opening weekend for 20th Century Fox. It had the highest weekend debut of 1999. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W21/?ref_=bo_wey_table_39 |- | 22 || || $51,399,863 || Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace broke Jurassic Park's record ($38.5 million) for the highest second weekend gross. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W22/occasion/us_memorialday_weekend/?ref_=bo_wey_table_38 |- | 23 || || $32,891,653 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W23/?ref_=bo_wey_table_36 |- | 24 || || Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me || $54,917,604 || Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me broke Batman Forever's record ($52.8 million) for the highest weekend in June and Mission: Impossibles record ($45.4 million) for the highest weekend debut for a spy film. It was the first sequel to gross more in its opening weekend than the original grossed in its entire run.|| https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W24/?ref_=bo_wey_table_35 |- | 25 || || Tarzan || $34,221,968 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W25/?ref_=bo_wey_table_34 |- | 26 || || Big Daddy || $41,536,370 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W26/?ref_=bo_wey_table_33 |- | 27 || || Wild Wild West || $27,687,484 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W27/?ref_=bo_wey_table_32 |- | 28 || || American Pie || $18,709,680 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W28/?ref_=bo_wey_table_30 |- | 29 || || Eyes Wide Shut || $21,706,163 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W29/?ref_=bo_wey_table_29 |- | 30 || || The Haunting || $33,435,140 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W30/?ref_=bo_wey_table_28 |- | 31 || || Runaway Bride || $35,055,556 || Runaway Bride broke Scream 2s record ($32.9 million) for highest weekend debut for a film featuring a female protagonist. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W31/?ref_=bo_wey_table_27 |- | 32 || || rowspan="5" | The Sixth Sense || $26,681,262 || The Sixth Sense broke The Fugitive's record ($23.8 million) for the highest weekend debut in August. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W32/?ref_=bo_wey_table_26 |- | 33 || || $25,764,991 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W33/?ref_=bo_wey_table_25 |- | 34 || || $23,950,008 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W34/?ref_=bo_wey_table_24 |- | 35 || || $20,099,149 || The Sixth Sense became the first film since Saving Private Ryan to top the box office for four consecutive weekends. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W35/?ref_=bo_wey_table_23 |- | 36 || || $22,896,967 || The Sixth Sense broke The Fugitive's record ($17.2 million) for the highest Labor Day weekend ever. It was only the second film after Titanic to gross more than $20 million for five weekends. It was also the first film since Titanic to top the box office for five consecutive weekends. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W36/?ref_=bo_wey_table_21 |- | 37 || || Stigmata || $18,309,666 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W37/?ref_=bo_wey_table_20 |- | 38 || || Blue Streak || $19,208,806 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W38/?ref_=bo_wey_table_19 |- | 39 || || rowspan="3" | Double Jeopardy || $23,162,542 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W39/?ref_=bo_wey_table_18 |- | 40 || || $17,018,808 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W40/?ref_=bo_wey_table_17 |- | 41 || || $13,541,285 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W41/?ref_=bo_wey_table_15 |- | 42 || || Fight Club || $11,035,485 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W42/?ref_=bo_wey_table_14 |- | 43 || || The Best Man || $9,031,660 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W43/?ref_=bo_wey_table_13 |- | 44 || || House on Haunted Hill || $15,946,032 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W44/?ref_=bo_wey_table_12 |- | 45 || || The Bone Collector || $16,712,020 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W45/?ref_=bo_wey_table_11 |- | 46 || || Pokémon: The First Movie || $31,036,678 || Pokémon: The First Movie broke Mortal Kombats ($23 million) for the highest weekend debut of a video game adaptation. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W46/?ref_=bo_wey_table_10 |- | 47 || || The World Is Not Enough || $35,519,007 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W47/?ref_=bo_wey_table_9 |- | 48 || || rowspan="3" | Toy Story 2 || $57,388,839 || Toy Story 2 broke The Waterboy's record ($39.4 million) for the highest weekend debut in November and for the holiday season. It also broke 101 Dalmatians' record ($33.5 million) for the highest Thanksgiving weekend debut, and The Lion King's records ($40.9 million) for the highest weekend debut for an animated film and a G-rated film. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W48/?ref_=bo_wey_table_6 |- | 49 || || $27,760,276 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W49/?ref_=bo_wey_table_5 |- | 50 || || $18,249,880 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W50/?ref_=bo_wey_table_4 |- | 51 || || Stuart Little || $15,018,223 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W51/?ref_=bo_wey_table_3 |- | 52 || || Any Given Sunday || $13,584,625 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W52/?ref_=bo_wey_table_2 |- | 53 || || Stuart Little || $16,022,757 || Stuart Little reclaimed the number 1 spot in its third weekend of release. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/1999W53/?ref_=bo_wey_table_1 |- |} ==Highest-grossing films== ===Calendar Gross=== Highest-grossing films of 1999 by Calendar Gross {| class="wikitable" !
